title: Album Page, "Elevation of Tower and Sketches of 7th Window, Possibly from Abbey of Chiaravalle, Milan", late 19th century
medium: Graphite on very smooth, off-white wove paper  tipped into binding with fabric
inscribed: Recto, in graphite, upper left edge: top of cornice to sill / of first w = 11.00; 1st cornice / to sill of 1st 9.20 / sill of 2nd window to sill of first = 5.32 / on other side... thickness of wall = .95 / opening of window 1.55, sill 2.30; below: 7th window - with sug... ... / height of sill to top of balcony; bottom right corner: 89.
dimensions: Sheet: 30.3 x 20.1 cm (11 15/16 x 7 15/16 in.), irregular
description: Vertical sheet with an elevation of a four story tower represented in the upper half of the sheet.  The tower is executed in the Romanesque style and contains many inscriptions of the dimensions of the wall thickness and height of the tower taken from various points.  The lower half of the sheet contains an elevation of a round-arched window opening supported by two slender columns.  The same window opening is seen in plan and section at right. The elevation and plan views contain measurements of some of their parts.

tombstone.epitaph: Album Page, "Elevation of Tower and Sketches of 7th Window, Possibly from Abbey of Chiaravalle, Milan", late 19th century.Graphite on very smooth, off-white wove paper  tipped into binding with fabric. Gift of Mrs. William Greenough. 1943-51-264.
